update: after requesting my account be deleted iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂm suddenly told i owe them money for disputed a delivery they never completed and didnÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt refund back in 2018!!!! the woman said she froze my account (the one iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂm trying to delete)ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ°ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ they want pictures of my bank statements and screenshots of my current statement to prove i withdrew the claim and then theyÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂll delete my account. seems very fishy. 

look. iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂve wasted so much money and time ordering with postmates. thatÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs my own fault. but man....their customer service is awful. theyÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂre rude and practically nonexistent. thereÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs been a few times where iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂve had missing items or something is not cooked(that one happens a lot??) and they never refund me. theyÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂll only credit you partially unless you go back and forth with them. the last order i made was not completed right. there was a cookie missing. i thought itÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂd be an easy refund/credit. so i submitted a ticket and they straight up told me in the exact words ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂwe looked into the issue and it actually appears there wasnÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt an issueÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ. so i went back and forth with their customer service and eventually once i requested a call from a supervisor(they kept sending the same generic template email to me) they credited $1 back to my account. you also apparently canÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt just delete your account like iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂve been trying to do. i requested a ticket for my account to be deleted and they said theyÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂd call me. just stay clear. please just make the drive or use a different service. this is a legal scam lol.

cant seem to find a phone to call them. i've used uber eats couple times in past week and strangely my credit card information got stolen . it happen right after website suggested i download uber eats app instead so i i though why not , i paid for my goods with credit card and now just 24 hours later i get message from my card issue asking have i made these transactions ?? i've checked my bank statement and i've been charged an extra chargers from uber in states , mind i'm in quarantine!!

i am shocked to know that uber eats took almost 20 days with lots of proof bank statements to figure out that this is a gateway problem. i suggest you upgrade your system and train your support team. i suffered a lot with your outdated system and unprofessional support team. f your using uber eats service, don't pay using credit card, or debit card. go for cod only, there is no guarantee of your money where it goes, uber eats will not take any responsibility,

i am shocked to know that uber eats took almost 20 days with lots of proof bank statements to figure out that this is a gateway problem. i suggest you upgrade your system and train your support team. i suffered a lot with your outdated system and unprofessional support team. f your using uber eats service, don't pay using credit card, or debit card. go for cod only, there is no guarantee of your money where it goes, uber eats will not take any responsibility, and they are not friendly with their loyal customers.

i gave doordash a chance a few years ago and was severely disappointed. for some reason, six orders in a row were canceled without telling me and most recently (about 2 years since iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂve last used the app), my credit card info was stolen and used to by $112 worth of bbq in a different state. 

i immediately called my bank to cancel the card, cancel the charge, etc and then called doordash to let them know my account was compromised. i spoke to a very nice woman who pulled up my info, refunded the $112, and promptly deleted my account. 

the next day, that ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂrefundedÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ money was gone from my account and i had 3 emails saying that i needed to provide bank statements showing that i was indeed scammed. 

this platform is poorly executed compared to its competitors and the customer service department is a mess of non communication.

i have ordered from doordash exactly twice. both orders were screwed up.  in trying to get a refund for missing items, i spent over 20 minutes chatting with a rep.  at the end of which, i was told my refund would be credited back to my card.
today, i received an email asking me for information they already have in their system.  there are plenty of reputable and responsible delivery services out there.  pick someone else.
thank you for raising this issue. i understand your concern, and i want to assure you that i'm here to help investigate and resolve this for you.
 
based on the information youÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂve provided, we need to gather some specific details before moving forward. please reply to this email with the following:
the last 4 digits of the credit card used
type of card (e.g. visa, mc, amex)
date of when the charges were placed
exact amount of charges
expiration date of the card associated with charges
optional: name of restaurant (listed on the bank statement)
screenshot of the bank statement
once i receive your reply with the above requested information, i will forward your case on to the appropriate team for further review.

i usually  order from work, so i placed an order thinking my location was on. within 2 minutes of hitting place order i canceled. in tried to change location and make exact same order... but realized location was still wrong. son within 4 minutes i canceled 2 orders. 

i never got a order confirmation or restaurant recovering, accepting, preparing... nothing. so i assumed it was all set. finally i made the correct order and location.

i never checked my credit card statement since my 2 orders said canceled. well a month later i get my bank statement and both orders which were exactly the same and placed and ordered within 4 minutes was on there. 

if it had n one of the orders i would have been less mad... or if i had known i was going charged i work have picked up the order!!!

after talking to multiple people from uber customer services they said they can only refund within 7 days..... and i should have f my statement. but i had trust since they said canceled. 

for such a large company to not refund my $.... and their system clearly messed up the cancel really puts a bad taste in my mouth.

i will never use or recommend this company for anyone. i work in a hotel and we recommend services all the time and i will not recommend them.

last month i found out i was being charged for the dashpass $9.99 that i never sign up for . i call them and tell them and then today they charge me again!!! . i looked at my bank statement and found out they been charging me for the last 7 months . for something i never signed up for . i'm about to block them from my credit card for stealing more money from me

make sure that you check the website, the app & your bank or credit card statement - especially if you use apple pay. a recent order was improperly billed. i received three conflicting receipts (in app, on website & by email). neither the correct billing method, nor the amount, was found. uber eats flagged my account for insufficient funds, after botching the billing. my bank statement showed that they charged less than the expected amount shown in apple pay. also, i found conflicting account profile info on the website. the address on file is one block away from where i live! the customer service repÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs response to these issues was downright incompetent.

my experience isn't good. this app freezes and doesn't let me change my credit card. i have paid for my monthly service and they took my payment and i see it on my bank statement. then they email me that they didn't receive my payment and my account says other wiseÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ°ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ

on august 18, 2020 i made an order for jalapeÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ±o peteÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs in studio city, ca. thru postmates for $43.56.  a few minutes after the order was approved, i get a text message saying the order was canceled due to my credit card being declined. i never got my food, yet the next day the charge for $43.56 posted thru my bank account, and the money was withdrawn. this was not a pre-approval, it was charged, and now they are showing no record of the transaction except that it was declined, which means they are refusing to return my money that they wrongfully took from my account. i call this stealing. 
iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂve contacted customer service numerous times, and they are refusing to do anything about it. iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂve even sent screen shots of my bank statement and still they refuse. 

i will never use postmates for anything ever again, please consider this when placing an order thru them. if there are any irregularities or itÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs to confusing for them to figure out you will not get your money back. 

i will also be informing jalapeÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ±o peteÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs that i will not be doing business with them as long as they go thru postmates.
will never use this service again. stole $400 from my credit card. i have bank statements to prove it. all they do is copy credit card numbers and steal from you.

$18 for frasier farm medium size chicken noodle soup. on my online bank statement it said they first charged me $57 dollars then gave me back $39. that weirds me out enough, never using this app again.

(review must be read)cant trust these food apps anymore to much to deal with and issues become frequent and *ubereats* app says unauthorised payments will disappear on bank statements i will show this to my bank tomorrow and deal with the lack of support. i have a lot of screenshots to prove my theories and emailed them to my email just incase people want to get sophisticated. this a warning to new customers who might be experiencing something similar. fees that don't even exsist? zero star.

**warning to ubereats customers** my mother is a senior citizen and often orders via this app, as a treat for her grandchildren. she just received her bank statements and ubereats has been deducting 2 payments for orders for months. on one occasion they took 3 payments for the same order. she contacted ubereats "customer service" and forwarded copies of her bank statements as requested. they point blank refused to refund the fraudulent payments as it was over 10 days ago. avoid this scam company!

8.9.19 ,10 pm i order food and paid thuru my debit card in app show s that time food deliverd estimate time 10.25 iam wait wait till full night food not deliverd iam sleep without food becuse of uber eats here sunday all hotels allso closed and try to contact uber eats but cantact opention not shows and my order details allso not shown in my app my bank statement all so attached in uber help conversation but no one is respond my mony all so given back ubwr eats such a bad expirence

a huge waste of my time and money. i placed an order and it was confirmed. 20 minutes later it said it was out for delivery and 20 more minutes it was cancelled. it said sorry but the vendor was not taking orders and my card was not charged. i quickly looked at my bank statement and there was the charge. there is no way to all or email them. i had to call my bank to fight the charge.

about 10 days ago i ordered food from a restaurant, 2 days after that i check my bank statements and realized that i was charged twice for the order. i then contacted customer support ( not to mention that was hard as they hung up on me twice.) once u managed to get a hold of them they told me that a refund was being processed and would be there in 5 business days. it has now been at least that and customer support told me that it was now too late to request a refund for my order. use uber eats!

absolutely disgraceful took my money for an order and didn't even put my.order through even though the shop was closed didn't get a refund as i thought because the shop is closed it won't take my money. but it did and only just realised on my bank statement so i asked for a refund even though no funds should have been taken from me in the first place when i asked for a refund i was told no because it was not requested within 48 hours they will not refund me so i'm now out of pocket.

absolutely horrible service. after the first order going smoothly i decided to place another. it said it would be delivered between 30-45 minutes. so around an hour later i got the notification saying my driver was arriving and would "wait five minutes" i ran outside to my curb to wait and didn't see anyone and within seconds i got another notification saying the delivery had been completed. i contacted customer service because obviously i didn't get my order and at first they kept telling me that it showed my meal had been delivered to me and the driver handed it to whoever was in front on my house lol. i kept fighting them telling them i never got and finally they decided they would give me a refund and that it would 5-10 business days. after the 6th day i see that i had actually been charged for that order on my bank statement and contacted customer service again. they proceeded to tell me that i had to wait the full 10 days before seeing anything. after the 10th day i still saw no refund and contacted them again. they took two days to get back to me just to tell me that they did process a refund but unfortunately had did it in the form of a credit to my postmates account. i was furious. i couldn't believe the lack of customer service and the lack of communication. i did not ask for a credit. i asked for a refund back to card and never got it.

after being sent raw food, and fighting for two days because the restaurant said to contact ubereats so i could get a refund, i was finally told i would be getting a refund. fast forward to two weeks later, iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂve received no refund, sent my bank statements 4 times to prove so upon request, and they close chats to avoid dealing with customers theyÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂre frauding. they keep saying to give 3-5 business days (itÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs been ten business days), theyÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂve change their story on the date i was sent the refund, and they have had the worst customer service. 

donÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt tell customers to contact you or submit paperwork to prove you screwed up, when you refuse to fulfill your obligations.

disgraceful company.

after they canceled my order, they still charged me for that and even when i contacted them, they said we have no history of canceling your order, so i showed them a picture of my bank statement that showed i was charged for it, but still no refund and all they said was maybe you are using another account!!! they are just a bunch of thieves! donÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt use this app.

after waiting an hour they canceled my order and when i checked my bank statement i was still charged for my food. could not find a number anywhere to call for customer service to get my money back. this is not the first time my order has been canceled after waiting over an hour for food.

although itÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs convent when needed iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂve use the app twice now and have been charged a extra on my bank statement then what is actually due apon receipt i dont know if any checks there bank statements but if iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂm already paying a tip and delivery why am i getting charged more on my card. i will not be using this app anymore.

although the service is good i'm rating the app so low over the many issues i've had with it. if you do plan to use the app make absolutely sure you check the payment method. this crappy app decided to switch to my dad's card randomly and we didn't find out until this months bank statement.

app is fine, customer service is terrible. a recent order was missing an entire entree. instead of refunding me when i reported the issue in the app i've had to call customer service 5 different times and still haven't been refunded. now they're telling me i need to provide bank statements pricing i didn't get the refund even though it still shows as pending on their end. with plenty of market competition i will happily take all my business elsewhere.

awful customer service. when i asked to speak to a manager my chat was immediatly disconnected. i had to fight to get a refund for a ruined meal. when i asked to have my doordashpass canceled i was told i didnt have one despite what my recent bank statement said.
banned me for no reason, say it's for fraud, eventhough i have every charge in my bank statement. going to a different app. the worst customer service. and they deleted my previous review too.
be careful what you order, check receipts and bank statements. they'll tell you they applied credits towards the purchase but charge you the full amount. will never order again.

be very careful when ordering with them. they will double charge your card and act as if they only charged. i sent in the bank statement showing there was a double charge and the situation still has not been handled. there is no live customer support so you have to email them everything which is even more frustrating because they can get back to you whenever they feel like it. by far the worst experience i have ever had and they definitely do not have to worry about me anymore. be careful

better check your order when you receive it before your dasher leaves because if anything is wrong you will have to jump through hoops to get a refund to your bank account. nobody on the phone understood what i was saying because they do not speak or understand english. minimum 5-7 business days to receive a refund to your card and thatÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs after sitting on the phone for an hour. they gave me no option to just have my food reordered so i had no lunch that day. never even saw the refund on my bank account, sent an email and then asked for a pdf of my bank statement to prove it to them. i absolutely refuse to do that. overall very poor customer service and i will not order from them again.

beware of double charges! uber likes to place ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂauthorizationÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ charges on your card, so be prepared to pay for your meal twice. the charge falls off, but it can take 3-5 business days for it to fall off.  sometimes it falls off quickly, other times like my most recent order, took 5 freaking days for it to fall off. for a 20 dollar order, it might not be a hassle, but for big family orders.. i spent 90 dollars on an order and was charged again because the first one was just an ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂauthorizationÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ hold, so i paid 190 dollars for chinese food!! be very cautious and hold them accountable, watch your bank statements! (btw, banks canÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt do anything to drop the authorization charge) so be careful!

canceled an order less than 2 minutes after submitting it. called restaurant who confirmed order was canceled and not even started.
saw charge on bank statement 5 days later, requested refund from postmates and they refused to give it, saying window for cancelation was only 3 days.
not cool.

cancelled my order without any reason and says i won't be charged for it. four days later my bank statement still shows the charge and no reversed charges. when you contact them they say that i should follow it up with my bank. be careful of this company. not trustworthy.

cappy service! i have used this app maybe 4 times and every time it's messed up or i don't get it at all. i then call customer service and that service is even worse! if a refund was needed it was like pulling teeth. in fact i never received a $24 refund and in the 7 phone calls and 9 emails i was always told that it would be taken care of or that an order was never placed on said day even after sending a copy if bank statement! don't waist your time or money, they won't correct any mistakes!

charged me extra after placing an uber order. i wouldnt have known about the reoccuring payment if i had not checked my bank statement. just a bunch of low life crooks. use someone elses service. all they do is scam you and overcharge for everything. absolute garbage.

charged me for a dashpass and will not refund my money even though they have established that i do not use the dashpass service. ive sent them my bank statement. sent them the date i waa charged. the amount a was charged. the email/phone associated with the account. everything. they still wont refund my money and they have the nerve to ask "has anyone in your family had access to your card?" just refund the 9.99 for the service you confirmed i do not have. theifs. take your money and question your household rather than just refunding the damn charge. this ia ridiculous. worst customer service i have ever experienced.

charged me for a order i never received and was told , it's ok just send us your bank statement and we will look into it. all in broken english and a few dozen people in the background. asked for supervisor and was told there aren't any available "they are all upstairs".

charged me, imidielty canceled my order, then never gave me a refund. it's been a month. no one has answer or will even let me show them bank statements. worst customer service. crooks! $30 they got me for be warned! no where near as good as postmates!

charged twice for one meal. then i was told i wasnt even though it was clearly on my bank statement. then get told it will takw 2 weeks to go back into my account! never again! $82 for a salad and chips ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ°ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ

charged twice for orders, the resolution is completely out of the hands of 
restaurant owners due to transactions are handled through doordash. 
requested refund, that has been a month ago. my bank will be challenging 
their orders to get my money back. the restaurant i reached out to was 
incredibly helpful but could not resolve the issue, they could not 
understand why the app would withdraw the order twice. after reading other 
reviews, it appears to be happening with other participants. i wanted this 
app to work, but their customer service fails miserably - people cannot 
support apps that operate appropriately only half of the time. go back to 
the drawing board, figure it out. start with the customers first. if you 
want to reward your patrons with a discount for referrals, actually 
implement it into the app.. i never received any sort of discount for 
bringing people on board. now i am having to apologize for the lack of 
service. repair your issues and take care of your supporters, i can revisit 
the application - but for now, i will be supporting other similar apps. for 
everyone else, check your bank statements and make sure you're not paying 
$35 for a couple tacos.

check your bank statements frequently, i've seen random mysterious payments being taken from uber eats (the last was ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£12) they told me to check with my bank because these fees should have just been pending charges for authorisation purposes.. but my bank says this money was taken from uber eats. very dodgey. i am uninstalling this app and would recommend anyone using it to keep a close eye on their finances. i don't think i'm the only one who's experienced this.

couldn't be more disappointed!! i was offered a ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£15 off promotion, which i applied to my order. the order went through with the discount, however when i checked my bank statement they had charged me the full amount two days later. after numerous emails, with a different uber employee responding each time, they blamed me with varying excuses from the code was invalid, to the promotion was a partner companies offer so we can't refund. uber eats... more like uber cheats! avoid at all costs!

customer service has no intention of helping you as seen in my case where i was charged literally double for an order i get all the time. i have been a customer of postmates for about six months and consumer of deli every services for over a year and have never encountered this level of blatant thievery.

in my first complaint, i told them about very incorrect charges. my order has always been $19.92(including a 20% tip) and was charged for exactly double of that, $39.84. thatÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs strange iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂm of itself. i got a price breakdown from the customer associate and they assured me that the extra cost may have been from pre authorization charges. this is not true as i received an email receipt dictating that  i was charged $39.84. this is reflected in my chase bank statement.

i complained a second timed, informing them of this and was informed that they would be ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂhappy to breakdown my charges.ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ i quickly realized that they were trying to give me the run around. i readied my third complaint with pictures of my previous orders where i was only charged $19.92, the outstanding charge of $38.94 and how it did not add up, a price breakdown by a previous associate that clearly added up to $16.60 (excluding tip), and finally my receipt that charged me $38.94. before submitting my email, i added an addendum that warned if they did not take my email seriously i would have to consider them to be scammers.

 i was met with the identical response that i got from my second complaint.

 if you have an issue, there is  absolutely no reason to contact customer service. having contacted them 3 different times, i can assure you that they have a system that analyzes your complaint and regurgitates something that fits the script.

in addition, there is no other way to contact postmates besides through email support. this is clearly set up so that postmates can give as little effort as possible.

i only hope that they can see this review and give me another avenue of response as i still have a membership with them.

do not trust this app! i got the dasher pass like five months ago to try it out. but i canceled it because i moved, and they couldn't deliver to my new address. so i told them i wanted a refund which never came. but now looking at my bank statements. they are still charging me for it. they have very rude customer service, and apparently take it upon themselves. to take out money from your account when ever they feel like it.

i am definitely not going to use this app. i placed an order and which i did cancel it within few seconds and my card was charged with the amount. the app said that it will take few business days to refund the amount. its been few days and my bank statement came and i was charged, though i cancelled my delivery within few seconds of ordering.

i am literally appalled at the quality of service i've received. 

i made 3 orders over a week period. i was charged for each of those orders, and the payments were processed.

a week later, i am charged again for those three orders, all at once. they double charged me for three orders! this was over $60.

this overdrew my account, and i was subsequently charged four "returned item" fees, $35.00 each, a total of $140.00. including the overcharges, $204.33. over $200. 

so naturally i contact postmates as soon as i notice, assuming i will be refunded and it's all just a big mistake. they don't have a phone line, by the way. 

i sent a very long email full of screenshots of my bank statements and postmates orders, detailing everything that happened. 

i get a literal paragraph long response essentially saying, "those double charges were pre-authorization fees." 

no explanation, no apology, no trying to work with me. 

first of all, how is it a pre-auth if it comes after my account has already been charged? how is a pre-auth charging me over $50 for one order? 

i replied, and got no response. 

my bank (boa) took care of it, refunding everything, and i'm so grateful for their service. 

no help from postmates. 

it's not the mistake that pisses me off. accidents happen (although, seeing all these reviews makes it seem like it's a pretty common occurrence). 

it's the service i received. if i'm spending $25 on $13 worth of food with your company, the least you can do is pretend to care about your customers.

please beware. what they are doing is borderline criminal and fraudulent.

please use grubhub, to avoid getting robbed

i used to love this app and would use it regularly to get food from my favorite restaurants delivered to my house. unfortunately i will never use it again as this company has repeatedly demonstrated an utter lack of customer service, and a penchant for committing unethical business practices. beware: if your order is incorrect or missing items, postmates will not fix the issue, and they will keep all of the money you paid, even if you back up your claim with bank statements, receipts, and food tickets pertaining to the order and proving your case. in reply to an email i sent requesting a credit for a missing item, they blatantly lied and stated i had been credited, when all of the records that i meticulously keep indicated otherwise, that i was charged 100% of the original amount. i showed them the initial bank charge, the same bank charge once it posted, and a ticket showing the date and missing item, and still they refused to help. in their email they told me to stop bothering them about the same issue and to stop using their service if i didn't like it. phenomenally unprofessional!!! this has happened on multiple occasions where an order is incorrect and it takes up to two weeks of emailing back and forth before i receive any form of compensation or apology, all the while the "customer service" representatives will send you disgustingly patronizing, condescending emails telling you why you're wrong and they're right (even though in the end, with multiple emails and lots of evidence demonstrating their mistake, they finally admit fault). this time, they refused to acknowledge fault and in so many words, told me to get lost. they would rather pocket your money illegally than retain a loyal paying customer. i will be switching to a competitor for food deliveries (probably uber eats - they're actually an organized company and they've never done me wrong) and will continue to inform everyone i know of this shady company who thrives only because of stealing money from their customers.

yesterday i ordered four sandwiches (two chicken sandwiches and two burgers) and sides from lucy's to celebrate by nephew's 1st birthday with my fiance, my sister and her husband. we waited approximately an hour from order time for the much anticipated food to arrive. when the food did arrive, two of the sandwiches were missing. we reached out to the driver and he said he delivered what he was provided by the restaurant and to contact ubereats for additional support. upon contacting and reporting the two missing items, we were refunded for the two missing sandwiches. however, given this was 50% of our meal, two people had to reorder and wait for additional food to arrive for another hour. we had to pay additional service, delivery fees, and tip, with a different delivery service. the original food was cold and soggy given sandwiches and fries don't keep by the time the new food was delivered (as we politely waited for everyone at the birthday celebration to have food before eating). no one enjoyed the food given the lengthy wait, and the majority of it was tossed as the buns were soggy and fries had turned to a wet mush. we wouldn't have ordered at all had we known that we would only receive 50% of our meal. i understand and appreciate refunding the food that did not arrive; however, as a result of only 50% of the food arriving, the remainder of the meal was ruined. i am overall very disappointed in the experience and am not satisfied with paying for two soggy burgers and fries. we clearly would never have spent a dime on ubereats if we knew this would be the experience. 

update: i have had to provide the details of my issues to customer service over four times now. each time i am told they already resolved the issue or that i need to reprovide details. no one has been able to resolve it and it seems like maybe the responses are automated and not even real customer service reps as no one acknowledges any of the details of my case. i am furious.

update: two hours later, no email response, no call, no text... still hungry, still still missing money that you stole...

update: it is now 8:50a pst i was finally able to find the support number (you can not find it in the app, you must look it up online) after being sent to the wrong department, i was finally sent to marlot in their claims department, who was extremely unhelpful, i may as well have been speaking to a recording. they were so bad at handling this call and they kept repeating the same stupid dialogue, that i completely lost it over the phone and demanded i speak to the supervisor.

let me tell you about this supervisor, the last employee i spoke to was a brick wall, whatever the driver says was the word of god. but not princess. no, princess read my complaint, listened to the evidence, and made an actual critical assessment of the situation. as needless as it should be to say in an instance where the driver was derelict in their duties, i will be refunded my money. after what seemed like 3 tooth extractions and a root canal, princess did make amends to their subpar hiring system.

in short, if you get screwed by an uber deliverer remember this.

1. if you miss the call you can not simply redial the number it was received from.

2. do not expect the driver to make any attempt whatsoever to ensure you receive your food outside of the single call the will make from the cross street of your neighborhood.

3. although their policies say the driver will deliver your food to your door, they will not.

4. if you order past 9p est do not expect to receive your food or any customer service whatsoever.

5. should your driver make no attempt at delivery be prepared to lose that money or prepare for the verbal barrage of your life because any subtle or polite demeanor is seen as weakness and they will try to keep your money.

6. just use a different service, save time, save your money, avoid ever having to deal with these people at all costs. 

if you are thinking of using uber eats contemplate this experience and ask yourself is the $2 more difference in delivery fee worth all this extra baggage.

i have ordered from this app a total of 10 times. i keep giving it a try even though every single time i do i say i never will again. 7/10 times i have ordered, the order has been incorrect or missing items. 4/10 times i have had a delivery person who has been so rude that it blew my mind. considering that you are literally only knocking on a door and handing a person food (five whole seconds of human interaction), you really have to try hard in order to be rude to that person. i didn't know it was really possible until i tried this app. i have had a driver yell at me for saying hello to them. you think i'm joking? i'm not. the driver arrived at my house. i opened the door. i said "hi." she immediately started yelling at me for "treating her that way." i'm 99% sure there were a bunch of hidden cameras around and i'm about to be the star of a prank show. 

i also really hate that the times i have had a really great, friendly delivery person, i felt i undertipped them because you're required to tip before delivery, so i always tip lower than i would have if i were tipping upon delivery. 

i would highly suggest sticking with postmates. i never had an incorrect order or a rude driver with them, you tip after delivery, and you can order from anywhere.

deleted the app... use ubereats and yelp 24 delivery instead...

there are several things wrong with doordash and they are mainly related to the way they operate, specially the "benefits" from having a dashpass membership

-first, i have noticed that for some restaurants, prices are more expensive than the prices for same items at the same restaurants in other delivery apps. so whatever money you think you think you are saving in delivery/service fees, you are paying it in the food 

-second, for some reason, the dashpass is something that only works with some restaurants, not all of them. in my city, only half of the restaurants are included under dashpass. why do i have to pay a membership for a service that only works half of the time? there are other apps that the pass applies to all the restaurants

-third, some days, there will be restaurants that show up as "closed" earlier than on other apps, and you will be forced to order from a different restaurant or from that same restaurant on another delivery app

-fourth, and more importantly, they try to fool you with discounts. for example, they offer a 10% discount on your order at local restaurants on saturdays (and by they way, it only applies to up to $5 off your order). if you try to check out quickly and you don't pay attention, you won't notice that by using the promo code for that discount, they automatically remove your service fee discount that you are supposed to have always for ordering at dashpass restaurants. that is really sketchy. 

i really really dislike this delivery app, and the only reason i have a dashpass is because my stupid credit card forced me into it for some reason that i don't understand because having a membership with them is seriously the opposite of a "benefit"

app does not recognize orders to allow you chance at their "promotions". i put that in parentheses because in the 3yrs i've used app i've never had chance to win a discount or % off my next order through their "promotion". yet they cram my email full of bs promotion offers that very specifically say "at completion of order you will have a chance to play or card game that gives promotional discounts". then when you contact them, they apologize but say "the link is also sent with your email reciept". it's not. i've sent them the actual emails back and sent snapshots of emails. it's all a big scam. only people who benefit from this service is them, not you. they make a % of your order, plus while reading fine print you give them permission to sell your data (eating habits, places of employment and residence, etc) to 3rd parties. so they make $$ on you twice each time you order. you're better off just googling local restaurants & calling them yourself. a lot of these restaurants will actually give you a better price or a coupon by calling but not directly through grub hub because they have to pay grub hub a % of the order. it's all a scam

awful customer service.  do not recommend. i found ubereats prices and selection enticing and ordered from a local restaurant. it took over 2 hours to receive my order when the initial estimate was 45 minutes. when the order arrived, it was missing food, and the food that showed up was not what was ordered.   in response, i submitted a complaint to ubereats and they promptly got back to me asking if i had received my food. i explained the situation and they never responded again, despite two other emails politely asking if there would be any resolution.   in short: long wait, wrong food, terrible customer service. avoid this service at all costs in favor of others.

(updated 12/17)it's a lot like facebook and twitter. depending on where you live it's one of those apps you essentially need to have. it's pretty good at what it does.   however i'm very upset by the updates to the past orders. i've long relied on this function to tell me the quality of my past orders. unfortunately, it only lets you see orders up to a year back.   yesterday, i meant that i ordered from a horrible restaurant that i should have remembered, but like many restaurants of the same cuisine they share similar names and menus. i checked my order history and didn't see it there so since it was late and they were open i ordered. to my chagrin, i recognized the food as soon as i tasted it.   there's probably a reason i haven't ordered from a restaurant for years. at the very least let me see all of my past reviews. i'd rather not leave for your competitors because of something so easy to fix.

yeah, i finally got my money back. it only took sixty-odd tweets, some personally directed at the founders and ceos if the company, plus two facebook postings, a tumblr post, and a one-star yelp review of the last business iÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂd ordered via doordash from. that is to say, if the money i got refunded were wages instead of a refund of money that theyÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂd (accidentally, they say) defrauded me out of, i would have been paid less than minimum wage for the writing. but of course, it wasnÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂt wages at all; it was a refund of the interest-free loan they'd helped themselves to from the credit card they had on file from the few times i tried their service. 

and man, they sure took their time giving me that refund of the loan they helped themselves to. in the meantime, i was getting chirpy pr verbiage about how sorry they were that dashpass ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂdidnÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂt meet my needs.ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂ uh, yeah, great job reframing the problem as one of customer dissatisfaction. as if my desire to actually approve charges being assessed on my credit card were just one of a number of equally valid consumer choices, instead of being fraudulent and a violation of their usage agreement with the visa corporation. 

it was gross and douchey and condescending, all at once. never again am i doing business with this company.

so itÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂs no secret that uber has a questionable past with both employees and customers, and has often been in headlines for all the wrong reasons. if youÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂre wondering what steps theyÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂve taken to become better in 2021 let me share my experience with them recently: 

my card is fraudulently charged by uber on february 4th, 2021 for a service i have not used since 2018 (3 years). 
i immediately reach out to uber who takes their sweet time getting back to me, so much so that my bank (shoutout to usaa) took care of it before they ever even replied. the charges were dropped and my card was replaced due to some other attempted fraudulent charges. 
i thought that was end of it, fast forward to june 17th, 2021. iÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂm super sick, trying to get some soup or something delivered so i download postmates and log in (because again i donÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂt use these services anymore) and what do i see? my account is frozen because uber is demanding i pay them that fraudulent charge.
uber was aware from february that it was fraudulent because i did eventually get in contact with someone but they never did anything about it 
i reach out via facebook messenger because there is no support help in app. you canÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂt talk to anyone. literally the only option is to pay them $10 i donÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂt owe them (yes uber is doing the most over $10 like they arenÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂt a billion dollar company) 
i finally get a reply hours later saying theyÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂve emailed the email associated with my account 
i send an email basically just repeating myself yet again because uber canÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂt be bothered to read (couldnÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂt even get what platform i reached out on right, i donÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂt use twitter)
i get an email back the next day (yeah somehow it takes 24 hours to send an email for a problem they created in the first place)  basically saying my account is on hold because my bank disputed the $10 charge and if i pay it i can use my account 
i email back saying no and informing them i will be opening a report with the bbb. iÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂm refusing to repeat myself to uber anymore because theyÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂre clearly not even reading the messages i send, otherwise they would have known i am very aware what my bank did since iÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂm the one who contacted them to do it.
all this over $10 i donÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂt even owe uber. use doordash, grubhub, or lyft. anyone but uber, unless you want to waste 4 months of your life over $10.

i have had frustrations around what i (and other users i spoke with) perceived to be hidden fees. there used to be a service fee for ordering that was a percentage of the overall order. it was annoying because it wouldnÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt be reflected in the cost until the very final page on which the order is placed. i think that the fee might still apply, but through some combination of my becoming more aware of its implications and avoiding large orders to minimize the absolute fee, i got over it. 

what i canÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt get over is what has happened over the past several weeks. i have seen firsthand half a dozen instances in which an order was aborted in a way that showed complete disregard for customersÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ time. in two cases, the order was cancelled without notificationÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂand in one of these cases it happened 90 minutes after the order had been placed. why? the restaurant was out of business. putting aside the issue of allowing orders to be placed to a defunct business, what does it say about doordash that they werenÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt aware of the situation (or couldnÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt be bothered to tell me) until after the food supposedly should have been delivered??). 

in the other two cases, the order was marked as complete about 40 minutes after ordering and i was charged, but the food was never picked up or delivered. it was only upon checking for the driverÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs location that i saw that something wasnÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt right. i then had to go through support to seek a refund (which, fast as they are, wasted even more time). 

bottom line is buyer beware. the app charges a premium but i suspect that rather than being applied to enhance service or software, itÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs used to placate customer complaints that result from major problems in doordashÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs systems. i might try them again in a year, but with all of the other options now available that werenÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt when they started, why bother...?

we have been with them about a year now. donÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt worry, iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂm going to give you many examples:

-uber bicycle:  order placed at approximately 1530 hrs. on 04.13.2019. bicycle driver picked up but unable to deliver due to flat tire. i only know this because the cyclist called the store.  somehow, uber managed to delete the order completely instead of canceling it. because the order had been deleted they had no record of it and were talking to me as if i was crazy. after several conversations with different people, i think we were finally paid for the order, maybe. if i had not been paying attention, we would not have been paid for the order at all and received no notification from uber at all.  this has us most concerned about the integrity of process, if it can be deleted instead of canceling. and also there was no way to contact the customer because they had deleted the order.

-also if you press them too hard, they will just cancel the order. i have been on a three-way call with uber and the customer. the customer service representative from uber is saying ok, we will call the customer and see what they want to do. the customer told me that they still want the order. however uber every time will tell me that they want to cancel the order and they will just cancel it even though the customer is on the phone with me saying that they want the order. this has happened at least five times, usually because a driver has been dispatched but they never show up. so 30 or 45 minutes goes by and iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂm asking uber if they can just dispatch a new driver. they cannot. they are unable to, so their solution is just to cancel the order.  a couple of times iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂve actually resorted to delivering the order myself because they screwed up so badly.

-order for shahroze: this order was picked up before we closed. the screen says customer canceled. when i called uber, the representative said that the driver canceled the order due to the restaurant being closed. this order was picked up. at first it said we got paid zero. i actually had to talk to somebody to get paid and then they still want to take commission. even though the driver picked up the order and it says order complete they were actually going to not pay us for the order. 

-several orders: several times the driver has picked up from the wrong restaurant. there is a note on uber for drivers that says specifically where we are located.  often times i will find that a driver has waited for 15 minutes at the wrong restaurant. the last time this happened (yesterday), i called the driver and i told them that they were at the wrong restaurant. i said iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂll see you soon right? and they said yes. five minutes later i left my restaurant and walked down to where the gps said that they were. i called her name and she did not answer. then i said listen, is anybody here from uber? she said yes. i said is your name ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ? she said yes. i said ok this is the order you were supposed to pick up. you were sitting at the wrong restaurant. i still donÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt think she understood what happened. make sure you call the customer soon as you realize this is going on. because iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂm assuming that the driver is probably telling them that thereÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs a delay on your end, even when the food is sitting on your counter while they are waiting at the wrong place because they are not paying attention.

-order 968c6 brad: sometimes they have a system wide error of catastrophic proportions.  such as was the case with this order. was on hold for 25 minutes to understand what was going on and was hung up on. ended up staying an hour after we closed to try to take care of the customer. when i finally got through they told me they were locked out and could not even give me the customer phone number. so i was unable to communicate with the customer what was going on. maybe we lost this customer, i donÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt know.  be sure to hand write customer phone number and code as soon as you get the order if you want to be able to communicate something with them. we have also had drivers pick up from the wrong restaurant and we cannot communicate with the customer about whatÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂs going on because when they marked picked up, their contact information disappears.

-2 large glitches in their system that have not been fixed. these are clearly system errors. the first is that we keep getting random calls at different times almost every day from an automated message through ubereats. the message says that it is elise calling from uber eats and that they are calling to let us know that the system is off-line. i have called about this 5 to 10 times and every time the representative assured me that the system is online and that there has been no interruption. the first couple of times i called the representative was aware of this system error and said that we can ignore the message. but it still has not been fixed, after four or five months. the second glitch.  do not choose option notify customer that you are out of item. it will lock you out of the order, give the customer 10 minutes to respond, and then it will cancel the order. i stayed on the phone with a customer while this was happening and they never received a prompt to answer. 

-when i called about these glitches, i was never transferred to technical support. even though these are obvious software issues, they want to replace the tablet. they then proceeded to tell me it would take a couple days to get the new tablet and that meanwhile our uber service would be offline. i told them no thank you and hung up. they want me to lose money because their only solution is to replace the hardware when the issue is clearly with the software.

 -if you run into any delays or you accidentally hit ready, do not bother to call them. they canÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂt do anything about it.

was a bit disappointed that i have to give personal identification information (pii) before i'm even allowed to access the app or what it offers to my area.

why do i need a receipt sent to both my email and my phone? why am i not offered an option to just select one or the other? what if i've given this app my number and email only to realize it's not available in my area? 

just suggestions? i would be more willing, i guess, to give away this information if i knew i had an option. if i was actually placing an order then yes, here's my phone number (just as if i was ordering from any other delivery spot) but i don't call them leave them my name and number and then say.... i don't want the food.

that's all. 

i'm sure it's a great app. just wish i would have been given a chance to see it and or check it out to see if it was something i would even be interested in.

i used this app while at work, but for some reason our street address is not recognized. the first statement in my address description is ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂgoogle does not recognize our address,ÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ and then i give more details, such as the street corner we are on, that we are located on the college campus in town, a link to a campus map, a description of landmarks on our street, a description of the building, and when i have time, iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂll type in directions from the restaurant to my office. i used the app more than 20 times even though many of my orders were late on several occasions- enough so that my coworkers made fun of me for still using it.

i have made two complaints. the first time, my order was an hour late. i sent in a delivery issue message through the app, they responded quickly and gave me a full refund. i was very happy with that outcome, so i continued using the app.  

the second time i reported, i included directions from the restaurant to our building, but my food was again ridiculously late (roughly an hour and a half). when the driver called me to get help finding us (and it was already very late at that point), they had their mother on their car speakers trying to help, which was extremely confusing because i was not sure when i was being spoken to. the driver then chose to yell at me when i did not immediately respond to a question directed to me. i informed the driver several times that i was unsure as to when i was being spoken to, but that was ignored. additionally, the driver argued with me about the location and loudly sighed and huffed during the entire 10 minute phone call. our campus is literally designed in a square that measures one mile around, total, so we are not a big place whatsoever, and my office sits on one of the corners! the driver never grasped the concept. i had a coworker try to help me after the driver continued to struggle to find us.

i just want to make it clear first that i never i mean never leave reviews on the internet because i am 22 years old and my generation typically doesn't do that. but when i say don't use grubhub in orlando, please take my word for it. absolutely horrible. i've been here on vacation for three days and have ordered food delivered to my hotel the past two nights. last night i waited three hours for 10 pieces of sushi and called the restaurant to see what was going on and the lady said that this always happens with grubhub and that the driver just never showed up. she gave me grubhub's number and i gave them a call and the lady on the phone sounded appalled that i waited that long and very generously gave me a $10 coupon as well as a refund. i decided to try again tonight with a different location and the same thing happened again. i waited for three hours for a pizza delivery that i was looking forward to and it never showed up. the restaurant closed and i couldn't even call. i called grubhub very upset and i received a refund again as well as $10 coupon again. i appreciate the kindness of the customer service people i spoke with but this is ridiculous. in a tourist filled city like orlando having drivers available should not be an issue and if it is, customers should be made aware immediately so that way they can make other plans before it's too late. i am now starving and nothing is open.

iÃÂ£ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂm not usually the person that will give out bad reviews. this is the second time i have received cold food from door dash. the first time i just let it slide. but today i ordered 5 guys. i watched on the tracker as the dasher went the wrong way and continued the wrong way until finally stopping on a street. he sat there for around 15 minutes while i tried to call and text him. finally after those 15 minutes and failed texts and calls he finally called me. i had to give him turn by turn instructions. he finally got here about 20 mins passed my estimated delivery time. he got out of the car in a tank top with no remorse for being late with our food. our burgers were cold and soggy as well as our fries being cold. the food was inedible and ended up in the trash. my wife called to make a complaint about it and we were offered a credit of $5. my order was over $30 and went in the trash. this place is ridiculous and i will never again make an order with them. i pray that uber eats make it to our location.

we have had two really bad experiences with this company and it's drivers. they allow their drivers to accept multiple deliveries even if your order is running late. the last incident was so incredibly outrageous and we feel conned. we order a $60+ dinner and not only did it arrive a half hour late, it arrived cold and smelling of cigarettes. the pizza crust even tasted like cigarette smoke. we noticed that the driver (they have a tracking feature) went to three locations prior to ours and only one was official (via the tracker). we received our food a total of an hour after it was picked up. when i connected with the customer service "chat" agent, after about 15 minutes of "chatting" they first offered a $20 credit and then i said the food is essentially inedible, they upped it to $38 credit saying that it was the max they were allowed to offer. they should have refunded my meal and said that they will ensure this won't happen again, but instead they chose to have an angry customer for life in sf who will only share this story everywhere. please note that this is the third incident just like this with this company, so please know i was patient. don't use this company. stick with the other more established and reliable options where they don't allow their drivers to take on many deliveries before you get your food after paying huge fees. you will get better service from dominos.
update: i just used my $38 credit today and i wish i could show you the screenshot of my tracker. the driver accepted four other deliveries before ours and picked up our food 20 mins ago and is just getting to their first stop. food will be cold. nail in coffin. do not use this app. the 5 star reviews have to likely be fake reviews.

i've been using postmates for years, and literally have spent thousands of dollars on this app. i was a postmates unlimited member for all these years, but now i've cancelled it and deleted the app because they are crooks. 

there are so often so many issues...food showing up hours late, showing up with incorrect items, showing up obviously tampered with, or not showing up at all. the app has some glich that makes it nearly impossible to report issues. i have their customer service email address luckily, so when there's an issue i email them.

most recently, i ordered 5 of the same item that cost about $10 each. the postmate informed me the store was out of that item and asked if i wanted a smaller replacement which cost $2. i agreed, he delivered 5 of the $2 item, and then i found that postmates had still charged me for the $10 items. i reached out to them, and get this: they said theyve issued me too many credits and refunds and therefore would not refund the charges for items i never received. so basically they stole from me. i tried emailing over and over again, asked to speak to a manager, for them to review the chat log between me and the postmate who delivered to me, and even to report them to the better business bureau, and they just completely ignored my emails. there is no number to call on the app. just completely shocking and enraging the level of blatant criminality and lack of care for their customers. 

let me tell you, i am not a free loader. i don't cheat the system to make a quick buck. like i said, i spent thousands of dollars on this app. sometimes hundreds in a day, buying meals for employees. what they were referencing was one incident in which recently our family's dinner didn't show up and was cancelled right before delivery time and i was left with nothing to feed my kids. and they gave me a $5 credit that would expire in 5 days. that's it. for even the greatest inconveniences like this, the most they would give to make up for it is $5 in credit, which expires in 5 days. it's insane to me. i don't even care about the money, but $5 is an insult and makes me feel completely unvalued. 

but to refuse to give me back money you illegally charged me for items i didn't get is just plain criminal. i don't know how they can get away with this. i'll be disputing it with my credit card company and not using them again. i've deleted the app so many times in the past because of all the issues i've had with them. but i keep forgetting how bad they are and reinstalling it. this time that definitely won't happen. i've never worked with such an awful company anywhere. and i never will again.

it is also important for you to know that in the past an employee from postmates sold my password info and almost a thousand dollars was charged to my card as a result. not to mention the criminals illegally using my card had my home address, where my children live! 

i'd be very weary before putting your personal info and credit card anywhere near this app. you will regret it, it's just a matter of time.

"hi shelly,

sorry to know about the trouble caused here and your order has been cancelled. the situation you have described is certainly not the experience we expect you to have.

we understand that this may be inconvenient for getting charged for the order never received.

since the order was cancelled more than 5 minutes after being placed, the restaurant/store had already accepted the order and started preparing it.

donot worries because i've also made a note with the restaurant about this issue and be sure that your feedback has been heard regarding this matter. please be assured that we're always working on improving our app, and your feedback helps us accomplish this goal.

in the future, please make sure your order is accurate before submitting it.

moreover, please be guided by the following when canceling an order. we've done this to help streamline the process and to save time:

- if you cancel after the restaurant has accepted your order, you will be refunded the delivery fee and any applicable busy area fee, but will pay for the cost of the food item(s) ordered, plus tax.

- lastly, if you cancel after the restaurant has marked the item(s) as ready for pick up, there will be no refund.

i hope this information helps. otherwise, please respond to this message with the details of what went wrong so we can help you further."

(lol!). i feel like iÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂm safer taping my credit/debit cards to my mailbox than i am entrusting them to postmates. i highly recommend that if you need/want delivery, you call a restaurant that offers delivery, or better yet, you take a break to go for your food yourself. i donÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂt have experience with the other food ordering apps, but my terrible experience with postmates puts me off from them all; you may still wish to scope out the others for yourself. my advice is that you do a hard pass on postmates and protect yourself from the scams that, as i read through the reviews, are apparently rampant on this app due to their complete lack of security. postmatesÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂ failure to keep your account and private information safe is your headache, friends. avoid this headache (or is that a stomachache?) altogether.

do not order food through this app! my girlfriend and i ordered chinese through ubereats. the food was prepared by the restaurant and picked up by the driver at 5:57 pm. the  driver was 17 min away according to the gps on the app, however, after 30 minutes, the driver was showing as 21 minutes away. we called ubereats support and explained our concern that our food was sitting in a car for an hour. the agent refused to provide us with any information about the delivery, and instead kept reassuring us that it was on the way. we eventually spoke with a manager, who confirmed that the food was picked up at 5:57. we spoke with the manager at 6:40 pm. sure enough, the food arrived cold, but the manager would not do anything for us and made us pay for the full order, because the delivery was made "within the acceptable window." i asked the manager what the acceptable delivery window was, but he refused to provide details, at first saying that it was privately determined by uber based on each order and the food therein. he then contradicted himself and implied that it was a set time period after each order is entered. use grubhub or doordash, both superior to ubereats!

i have been a loyal customer for years (basically since these guys first started out and their prices were ridiculous - but hey, food delivery from basically any takeout restaurant without having to peel myself away from my netflix binge, i'm there). anyway, probably placed 50-60 orders and never had a problem with the service until recently (sometimes the restaurant would cause a bit of a delay, but never the driver's fault). about a week ago, i placed a large postmates order from an italian place for my family - probably $200 of italian (not my typical $10 chik-fil-a / taco bell, so i understand this looks inconsistent with my previous order pattern). some crazy red flag must have been put up because not only did they cancel my order (we had to place the order directly through the restaurant and pick it up), but i got an email shortly thereafter saying that my account has been put on hold. okay, that's fine, inconvenienced but i get it, just trying to protect me. the kicker is that in the email, they said that the only way to remove my account from hold was to provide proof of id / proof of address (giving a utility bill as an example)... what?! i did not provide either of these private documents to sign up for the service, and i'm certainly not going to provide them now (quite honestly, has all the makings of a scam and me looking like a doofus when my identification gets stolen all because i wanted a chalupa and a chicken quesadilla). i responded to the generic email saying that i feel uncomfortable providing this information only to receive essentially the exact same email in response to my response. in this email, i wrote that i have never been asked by doordash or any other food delivery service to provide this information and included the following: "i will be deleting the postmates app and ceasing to use your service moving forward and will be sure to spread the word about this incident. this food delivery service has gone way downhill and is no longer the best option in a very crowded industry." good luck, postmates.

i want to share one of the worst customer service experiences i recently had during 3 calls with 4 different individuals. about 30 minutes after i placed my order i received a notification email that delivery was being attempted unsuccessfully. it was then that i realized the address for the order was set to a random address nearby but not to my set ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂhomeÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂ location on the app. i did not catch it when i placed the order, because i've used the app before and this error had never presented itself before. i had no reason to believe the app would make such an error. 
 
i received a phone call around the same time as the email notification, but when i answered, although i could hear that someone was on the other line, they did not respond and they hung up while i kept saying ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂhelloÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂ.  i called right back and got the corporate customer service menu; when i was unable to reach someone, i began to redial, and i asked my sister to also call from her phone so we could double our chances of reaching a representative quickly to correct the issue. when someone finally answered, it was on my sisterÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂs phone that is not tied to my account (important, because they later tried to indicate we were using an ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂincorrect phone number.ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂ)
 
the first person we talked to verified my address and the phone number on the account, and we quickly straightened up the wrong-address issue. he called the driver and told us that the driver was 5 minutes away and on his way to us. knowing that i should take some responsibility for not realizing the app had not captured my set ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂhomeÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂ address, i was grateful that they were willing to work with us.

much later, still no delivery, so we called again. this representative (after again verifying address and phone ) called the same driver who said he had decided to deliver another order first and now needed gas, but would deliver to us next, in about 10 minutes.again, feeling that the driver had been inconvenienced because of the address issue, i did not raise a fuss, but wondered privately why no one had communicated the change of plans to us (in app or email or whatever).
 
even later when there was still no delivery, we called a third time, and this time we were told that the order had already been delivered to the first wrong address, (apparently during the same time the first rep had been telling us that the driver would be at our door in 5 minutes) . this third rep appeared to have no knowledge of what we had been told by the previous 2 representatives, and seemed not to care at all. this was mind boggling, so we proceeded to ask for a "supervisor" . her reluctance to listen to our story, her failure to research the previous 2 calls, and her predisposition to believe we were lying, resulted in the ultimate worst client experience i've had this year. more than 2 hours after the order had initially been placed, the ÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂsupervisorÃÂ£ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂ reluctantly agreed to refund the order just to get us off the phone. there was no attempt to apologize, no discussion of how to make it right, no attempt to offer to take  a new order, or attempt to give us the benefit of the doubt.
 
for a company that is striving to reach national acclaim and compete with up and comers like door dash and uber eats, you are way behind the curve and will continue to fail unless you pay attention to your cx processes and replace your quality assurance staff (if a qa department even exists) with qualified representatives. once this review is placed, your app will be deleted.

we apologize that your delivery was canceled. there are a few reasons that might cause your order to be canceled. some of those reasons include:

the merchant is closed due to a private event, emergency, or a change in their operating hours.
the merchant is too busy to take new orders.
the merchant cannot accept payments due to an equipment malfunction.
the merchant is cash-only. postmates cannot place orders at cash-only merchants.
if your order is canceled, you will receive a text message, email, or push notification explaining the reason for the cancelation. to prevent other customers from running into the same issue, we will temporarily deactivate the merchant on our platform until the issue is resolved. rest assured that we will investigate the reason behind the cancelation to prevent it from happening in the future.

stay far away, your personal info is at risk with their flimsy security. your card is easily accessed by malicious people. beware. can't even remove your card from the app interface, instead they make you go to the website.

worst app for becoming a delivery driver. the sign up process is bugged they made me download fleet to enter my personal information in, it's all very shady. i keep getting emails stating my social security number is wrong or email / password is wrong. when i logged a help request, jessie from new york would rather get a star rating then solve my issue. also can't delete account information. think carefully how willing you are to let this website & fleet website have your personal info!

0 customer support if i could i would give it 0 stars literally 0 reliable food delivery service oh yeah, and got all my credit cards stolen from the uber app, they had a security breach and no official notification to the customers, i found out through news. another update - the 20-30 min order turned to a 50min order cause they gave the delivery person another 3 deliveries before mine. they don't give refunds if your order has left the store.

after using this service 2 or 3 times and deciding to sign up for their dash pass subscription service, thinking it to be a good deal, my account was promptly hacked and my email and password for it changed. normally in this instance most services send an email asking if you made the change and if not please click this link to revert the change and open a page to change your password. the email i get from door dash basically tells me the change has already been made and approved and if i want to revert it i have to submit a request to change it back...when they eventually get around to it. not only that, but the page the link they do provide leads to...is their faq page. so now i have no obvious way to report this problem and their number for customer support is absolutely nowhere to be found. i had to google it from a third party site! upon finally finding the number and contacting door dash and notifying them of the problem i get a tech who barely seems to understand me and i have to explain to him several times what the issue is. eventually he tells me that the account has had its ability to make purchases frozen...but the thief still has access to my account and can see my card numbers. it took multiple attempts at calling and speaking with multiple people (apparently all of their supervisors are always too busy to answer a phone call) before someone finally reassured me that they completely closed the account and that the thief could no longer access my information. ok, good. everything is settled...except an hour later i get an email from a tech support treating the issue like it's some everyday bug!!! please submit a screenshot, tell us more about the problem, etc. what a joke! they submit this "to the people that handle these issues" but it turns out they just sent it over to tech support like i'm experiencing a glitch in my app??? 10/10 will not use this horrendous service ever again, and if you value your financial security you won't either.

after your service was hacked, you deactivated my husbands account and instructed him to reset his password. after resetting his password, the account was still not activated. poor service, poor security.

always an issue.....always. charging me for stuff i didnt get, not refunding me when i dont even get my order. it's just a hot mess. plus their security is trash. just freaking go to the store and get off your couch.

am i upset ? that does not explain my fury.
postmates needs to make a way to contact them via phone
